manifest.title: Kimai
manifest.author: Kevin Papst
manifest.description:
### Overview

Kimai is a free & open source timetracker. It tracks work time and prints out a summary of your activities on demand. Yearly, monthly, daily, by customer, by project … It’s simplicity is its strength. Due to Kimai’s browser based interface it runs cross-platform, even on your mobile device.

### Feature list

* Mobile ready
* Multi user
* Multi language
* Teams
* Projects
* Activities
* AM/PM format
* Timesheet filter
* Weekend rates
* Archiving
* Permissions
* User profile
* Theming
* User registration
manifest.changelog:
* Update kimai to 2.48.0
* [Full Changelog](https://github.com/kimai/kimai/releases/tag/2.48.0)
* Allow to configure export templates to be used by regular users (add them to the list in `My times` / `All times`) ([#5789](https://github.com/kimai/kimai/issues/5789))
* Simplify export template title handling ([#5789](https://github.com/kimai/kimai/issues/5789))
* Added `type` attribute for `DayAddOn` ([#5789](https://github.com/kimai/kimai/issues/5789))
* Added styles and icons for `DayAddOn` ([#5789](https://github.com/kimai/kimai/issues/5789))
* Fixed wrong widget labels in German ([#5789](https://github.com/kimai/kimai/issues/5789))
* Fix API doc (Team ID for new projects) ([#5789](https://github.com/kimai/kimai/issues/5789))
* Translations update from Hosted Weblate ([#5748](https://github.com/kimai/kimai/issues/5748))
* Add translation links to README ([#5798](https://github.com/kimai/kimai/issues/5798))
